description: Creates an Amazon Web Services Migration Hub Refactor Spaces route. The account owner of the service resource is always the environment owner, regardless of which account creates the route. Routes target a service in the application. If an application does not have any routes, then the first route must be created as a DEFAULT RouteType. When created, the default route defaults to an active state so state is not a required input. However, like all other state values the state of the default route can be updated after creation, but only when all other routes are also inactive. Conversely, no route can be active without the default route also being active. When you create a route, Refactor Spaces configures the Amazon API Gateway to send traffic to the target service as follows: When you create environments without a network bridge ( CreateEnvironment:NetworkFabricType is NONE) and you use your own networking infrastructure, you need to configure VPC to VPC connectivity between your network and the application proxy VPC. Route creation from the application proxy to service endpoints will fail if your network is not configured to connect to the application proxy VPC. For more information, see Create a route in the Refactor Spaces User Guide.

parameters.name: ApplicationIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID of the application within which the route is being created.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: DefaultRoute
parameters.description: Configuration for the default route type. ActivationState (string) --- If set to ACTIVE, traffic is forwarded to this route's service after the route is created.

nested_params.name: ActivationState
nested_params.description: If set to ACTIVE, traffic is forwarded to this route's service after the route is created.

parameters.name: EnvironmentIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID of the environment in which the route is created.

parameters.name: RouteType
parameters.description: The route type of the route. DEFAULT indicates that all traffic that does not match another route is forwarded to the default route. Applications must have a default route before any other routes can be created. URI_PATH indicates a route that is based on a URI path.

parameters.name: ServiceIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID of the service in which the route is created. Traffic that matches this route is forwarded to this service.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the route. A tag is a label that you assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key-value pair.. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: UriPathRoute
parameters.description: The configuration for the URI path route type. If set to ACTIVE, traffic is forwarded to this route's service after the route is created. AppendSourcePath (boolean) --- If set to true, this option appends the source path to the service URL endpoint. IncludeChildPaths (boolean) --- Indicates whether to match all subpaths of the given source path. If this value is false, requests must match the source path exactly before they are forwarded to this route's service. Methods (list) --- A list of HTTP methods to match. An empty list matches all values. If a method is present, only HTTP requests using that method are forwarded to this route's service. (string) --- This is the path that Refactor Spaces uses to match traffic. Paths must start with / and are relative to the base of the application. To use path parameters in the source path, add a variable in curly braces. For example, the resource path {user} represents a path parameter called --user'.

nested_params.name: ActivationState
nested_params.description: If set to ACTIVE, traffic is forwarded to this route's service after the route is created.

nested_params.name: AppendSourcePath
nested_params.description: If set to true, this option appends the source path to the service URL endpoint.

nested_params.name: IncludeChildPaths
nested_params.description: Indicates whether to match all subpaths of the given source path. If this value is false, requests must match the source path exactly before they are forwarded to this route's service.

nested_params.name: Methods
nested_params.description: A list of HTTP methods to match. An empty list matches all values. If a method is present, only HTTP requests using that method are forwarded to this route's service.

nested_params.name: SourcePath
nested_params.description: This is the path that Refactor Spaces uses to match traffic. Paths must start with / and are relative to the base of the application. To use path parameters in the source path, add a variable in curly braces. For example, the resource path {user} represents a path parameter called --user'.

nested_items.name: ApplicationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the application in which the route is created.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the route. The format for this ARN is ``arn:aws:refactor-spaces:region:account-id:resource-type/resource-id ``. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

nested_items.name: CreatedByAccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the route creator.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the route is created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the route was last updated.

nested_items.name: OwnerAccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the route owner.

nested_items.name: RouteId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the route.

nested_items.name: RouteType
nested_items.description: The route type of the route.

nested_items.name: ServiceId
nested_items.description: The ID of service in which the route is created. Traffic that matches this route is forwarded to this service.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the route. Activation state only allows ACTIVE or INACTIVE as user inputs. FAILED is a route state that is system generated.

nested_items.name: UriPathRoute
nested_items.description: Configuration for the URI path route type.

nested_items.name: ActivationState
nested_items.description: If set to ACTIVE, traffic is forwarded to this route's service after the route is created.

nested_items.name: AppendSourcePath
nested_items.description: If set to true, this option appends the source path to the service URL endpoint.

nested_items.name: IncludeChildPaths
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to match all subpaths of the given source path. If this value is false, requests must match the source path exactly before they are forwarded to this route's service.

nested_items.name: Methods
nested_items.description: A list of HTTP methods to match. An empty list matches all values. If a method is present, only HTTP requests using that method are forwarded to this route's service.

nested_items.name: SourcePath
nested_items.description: This is the path that Refactor Spaces uses to match traffic. Paths must start with / and are relative to the base of the application. To use path parameters in the source path, add a variable in curly braces. For example, the resource path {user} represents a path parameter called --user'.
